Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Estela C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a quite area at walking distance to the most touristic points in Rome. The rooms occupy the third floor of a beautiful old seignorial building. The bedrooms are very nice decorated and, the most important, equipped with very comfortable bed. Both the bathroom and the bed are very clean. The savonettes provided by the hotel smell great.

Reviews.Title: “Great decision!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda F
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Hotel Oceania. The location is excellent with public transportation, great restaurants and shopping very nearby. The rooms were quiet and clean. The staff was very gracious and helpful and the serve really delicious coffee! Rick Steves (2012) certainly didn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: sudsysue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently made our first trip to Italy. With the help of Rick Steve's 2011 Italy book we made reservations at Hotel Oceania for 4 nights during our stay in Rome. What a delightful hotel. It's truly charming and the staff (thanks Anna and Roberto for all your help!) were very helpful. We contacted the hotel prior to arriving in Italy and had them arrange 2 tours for us.....the Vatican and the Colosseum and the Forum....what a great tours! Highly recommend that you arrange for a tour (especially the Vatican to avoid the lines!!!). The breakfast was very nice and they served the best cappacino!! They also have the cutest funky elevator! I highly recommend this hotel as it's located in an excelled safe neighborhood and easily walkable to several of the main sights. If you don't feel like walking the main street is just a block away with all the bus routes available. You can purchase an all day bus pass for 4 Euro's per person.

Reviews.Title: “My Roman Home”
Reviews.Author: Wanda K
Reviews.Content: We spent nearly two weeks in this wonderful hotel and I was truly sad to leave. The rooms are clean, spacious, well-appointed. The location could not be more central and all the staff are extremely knowledgeable regarding Rome, it's sights, transportation routes, restaurants. They made us feel like honoured family guests. I cannot recommend The Hotel Oceania highly enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and homely”
Reviews.Author: FrenchSandgroper
Reviews.Content: This hotel which occupies the third floor of a building not far from the Ministry of Defence was a beaut place choice to stay in Rome. It is about a ten minute walk from Termini, and just off Via Nazionale which has plenty of useful bus stops. The room was comfy, the bed nice and firm. I wouldn't have minded real towels though - those provided are like large thin tea towels, and rather hard to dry yourself with. The room was impeccably clean and kept so during our 4 day stay. Breakfast comprised bread and several different, very sweet cakes, which we found hard to eat so early in the day. Juice and tea and coffee were very good. There was nothing in the way of yoghurt, muesli, eggs etc. I also loved hearing the opera singers voices wafting upstairs ( as mentioned by previous reviewers). All the staff were helpful and friendly. I'd stay here again in a flash. On our last day there we discovered a Sicilian patisserie in an arcade just off Via Torino ( the next street) and I think we would have eaten there more often had we known before. It also has very pleasant helpful staff and an incredible range of food. The Chinese restaurant Lon Fon just down the street from the hotel was also very good and quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: giorthan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an interesting located with well appointed rooms, nice breakfast and very personable staff. It has a very homey feeling to it, because we always felt like we are returning home after a long day of enjoying the sites of Rome. We will not forget the unorthodox lift, the pleasant scent of it and the landing balcony. We would definitively stay here again and we would recommend this hotel without any hesitation, if you are looking for a value based selection and a hotel that has character, minus the glitzy lobbies, and all the other usual hotel trappings.

Reviews.Title: “What I imagined when I thought of Italy”
Reviews.Author: julessandiego43
Reviews.Content: What a cool hotel. Recommended by Rick Steves in his 2011 guide to Italy it was not a disappointment. Traveling a little off season made it affordable, and the location was pretty great. Its another tucked away hotel in a residential neighborhood on the 3rd floor of a really cool old building. The elevator is not surprisingly small, but it starts essentially a few steps up from the entrance so that's a bonus. Our room was nice, but what I REALLY loved was the windows that cranked open to the center of the courtyard/building that was flooded with the sounds of opera singers practicing from the church on the bottom floor. At first I thought it was coming from a neighbor 1 story up, but when I asked our host about it he told me about the church downstairs. The beautiful sounds of their voices flooded up through the center of the building-it was like I was in a movie. Its the little nuances like this that made my stay so memorable. Id like to mention Roberto and how sweet he was. He was always available and we had a few nice chats with him. The rest of the staff that we met briefly were also very nice. I like having a bar where you could get a coffee or cocktail and walk it back to your room steps away. Trevy Fountain was about a 10 minute walk, and the walk was great because it forced us to live like a local. We took the local metro and got around mostly by walking, its easily navigable by foot. The room was clean, and the hotel was really peaceful and quiet.I loved the catwalk that ran between the 2 sides of the hotel where you can sit at a bistro chair and enjoy a moment. Free Wi-Fi was also really helpful. There are a few small restaurants on the block where you can get a nice meal, a light snack or a bottle of wine for take away. One more quick mention about Rick Steves, if you are familiar with him you know that he stays in really cool and unique places all around Europe with accommodations from 5 star Hotels to minimalist Hostels, He happened to have stayed at Oceania few weeks earlier from our visit and had signed his latest book for the Hotel. He definitely walks the walk when he gives advice about where to get the best bang for your buck and this was 1 of those places! I cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Party of Six Recommends Hotel Oceania For Rome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn R
Reviews.Content: We were a party of six and chose this location after viewing one of Rick Steve's video's. He was correct in recommending this hotel. We enjoyed everything about this hotel. The breakfast was perfect to start the day with fresh baked breads, danish and a hot Italian coffees. We used the bus stop every day during our stay that was only apx two blocks away. We also tried several restaurants in the area that were superb. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable. The outdoor veranda was also perfect to be able to sit outside even though it was a little chilly. But we loved it. We will be back to Rome and will hope to be able to stay at this location again. I have already recommended this location to several of my friends and family for their future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it - great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lelbeenthere
Reviews.Content: We would stay here again. Great location, spacious rooms, good, friendly service........ A bonus was classical music drifting up from the opera school on the level below.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heather A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Oceania for 4 nights in December and it was perfect. The staff were very helpful. The rooms were warm, clean, and comfortable. The location is ideal. You are very near a metro stop, not far from the main train station, and good restaurants are nearby. I would stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoAnn L
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this hotel; Spacious rooms, comfortable beds and large spacious bathrooms. There is a nice patio with free wifi, where you can sit back and enjoy a glass of wine or an expresso after a long day of touring. The staff are all personable, they are helpful and speak english. Breakfast was great, they serve good rolls, beautiful pastries, and great coffee. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A marvelous hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MarcZicree
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay, with pretty and spacious rooms, nice sitting room, great breakfast room, Internet, very helpful staff who speak fluent English (especially Roberto). Very central, just around the corner from the Metro. We’d go back in a minute. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Nuclearwaste
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for travel in and around Rome -- near the metro and train station making visits to the major sites easy and rapid. The Hotel staff is friendly, helpful, and very professional. Our stay was a joy.

Reviews.Title: “Less expensive relative to most Roman hotels”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinKizzy1
Reviews.Content: Taking Rick Steeve's advice, we stayed at the Oceania for four nights in Oct 2011. The hotel is four flights up (a creaky elevator gets your luggage there); so be prepared for some muscle-toning climbs. The staff was very friendly and the room clean. Rome is noisy at night and if you want the window open, you will hear the street sweeper and the garbage trucks along with the traffic. The bathroom is modern and includes a bidet, although the towels (very smooth and thin, although adequately absorbant and changed every day) might be a bit of shock for American guests. The room included an in-room safe, a comfortable bed, and a small refrigerator. The included breakfast featured a large roll, juice, and choice of hot beverage along with a buffet offering your choice of pastries. The area seemed safe to walk in at night. We would have no qualms about recommending the hotel or staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Molto Bene!”
Reviews.Author: Francesca O
Reviews.Content: Lovely autentico, charming. Here are just some of the staff names - Anna, Daniel, Daniela, Roberto, Patrizia - and they are all wonderful, helpful, and friendly. The layout is so unique, and because other businesses and residences share the building with Hotel Oceania, there is a feeling that you are actually living in Roma. The building is connected to a church and a church choir and opera singing filled the spaces. The courtyard satisfies the imagination of Italia with wonderfully colored stone, flowers, hanging vines, open sky, with laundry strung outside apartment windows. The breezeway has small tables and chairs and is located where the one-of-a-kind elevator brings people up and down. Indulge yourself at breakfast: warm, round, popover-like bread loaf served fresh from the oven onto your plate and a buffet bar of cakes and cheeses, honeys and jams. The capuccino is fabuloso and will probably have you drinking more of it than you intended. Easy access to public transportation, both buses and trains, as well as taxis and other necessities like ATMs and sandwich shops. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: nparadice
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived in Rome without the third member of our party (she was flying standby and had to wait until the next day to leave the United States) who had actually reserved our room and the only one of us that had ever been to Europe. I was, to say the least, more than a little anxious after losing a night's sleep on the flight and unfamiliarity with our surroundings. We arrived unscathed at the Hotel Oceania and Anna greeted us warmly and allowed us to store our luggage (it was only 10:30a.m.) until our room could be readied. We returned about 1:00 and our room was ready. It was one of the cleanest room I have ever encountered. We very much enjoyed our stay, encountering numerous American travelers on the terrace. The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful, even passing on a message (via email) from our stranded friend as to her plans to join us tjhe next day in Tuscany.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location for a family of four in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tbellmatsen
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended to us and was a little more than I'd hope to spend, but after looking around at other options I decided the location and extra comforts were worth paying for. The staff were brilliantly friendly and helpful. They have advice on how to get the best deals on tickets, taxis and meals. The room was enormous and really comfortable. The breakfast was continental and fresh, with lovely fresh coffee! The towels are odd to us Australians who love our fluffy, Egyptian cotton - but when in Rome.... They are more like v large tea towels! The service was excellent, the beds were comfy, the room was spacious, the wifi access was fast and efficient from the landing and the coffee was lovely. The shower could have been a bit more consistent in temperature but that's not an Oceania problem that's something that's we've suffered our entire European trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Delta_BCAllen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights in this hotel and very much enjoyed the stay. Our room was No. 11 and was large, comfortable, very clean and had a good sized bathroom. The A/C worked well and had a remote control. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English and were helpful on any questions we had. Free WiFi which we used while sitting on the patio terrace enjoying wine which they have to sell or bring your own, no problem. The hotel is in a great quiet location off the main tourist attractions but easy walking distance to the Metro, Termini station and many major sites for us. Many bars and restaurants and a grocery store are close by. Breakfast was good with a selection of pastries, tea, coffee,,juice, cheese, a delicious large bun and packages of small bread style toasts. Plenty for us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: tolivinclean
Reviews.Content: This is my first visit to Italy! The Oceania was our very first evening spent in Rome & it set the tone for the rest of the trip! excellent staff! the view from our huge window, breathtaking! our street was nearby everything, especially the termini in Rome which was great because we left the following morning aboard the Trentitalia for Florence! I travelled with 3 other girls, the 4 of us feel exactly the same about the Oceania! loved it!! everything about it! Definitely visiting Italy again, 13 days wasnt enough!! & definitely will be visiting The Oceania again! loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at Hotel Oceania”
Reviews.Author: AndyMM44
Reviews.Content: The staff and owner at this hotel are the absolute best I have ever encountered. Always on hand, willing to help with anything, courteous, friendly and warm. The rooms are clean and beautiful. The breakfast is perfect: Pope hats, pastries, tea, coffee and juice, all served in a beautiful dining room. Very classy. This hotel is in walking distance from the train station, although if you have small kids, you should taxi it. We also walked to Spanish Steps, Trevi, Forum and Colosseum areas. There is casual and fine dining (stick with casual), shopping, everything in walking distance. Don't miss Santa Maria degli Angeli church a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tweedinator
Reviews.Content: Loved Hotel Oceania! It was a site for sore eyes after traveling 20 hours to Roma. Our room was surprisingly bigger than anticipated and the A/C was phenomenal for Italy. The staff was very prompt, friendly and helpful with restaurant suggestions, directions, and researching pending train strikes. Wi-fi is available in the breakfast room/lobby and outdoor patio. The coffee was excellent!! with a variety of sweets offered for breakfast. We would have preferred some additional protein options outside of the cheese offered, but it wasn't a major problem. We also enjoyed bottle(s) of wine out on the patio in the evening for our very own happy hour. Hotel is near the Termini station and the Republica stop which was convenient. It's also in the same building as a Methodist church whose choir is quite talented (listen for them on Sunday afternoons while you take a siesta). There was also a lone trumpeter, somewhere nearby, who would play a little vignet each morning @ 7am. We could hear traffic outside our room beginning @ 730 AM on weekdays, but that was expected staying in the city. If we ever find ourselves back in Rome - this will be the place we stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmdje
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in 2009 in April. The hotel is up several flights of stairs with a very small elevator. The rooms are small as are the bathrooms. They were willing to set up a family room for 5 for our 3 kids. This saved us a ton of money to avoid 2 separate rooms. The location is not create but an easy taxi ride anywhere you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: TravelingJulianne
Reviews.Content: Although this is not located in my favorite area of Rome, the marvelous rooms, the charming and helpful staff, and the reasonable price make it a "hit." The tiny elevator delivers you from the busy city to a calm oasis of warmth and care. We have stayed at Hotel Oceania on two vacations in Rome, and we will return many times. This would be an especially good place to stay on a first time to Rome, because Roberto and his colleagues are terrific, knowledgable, and patient!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: RosterPreston
Reviews.Content: We loved this little place. We had a great time in Rome and the staff helped us with all that we asked for help with. I had to send a package and the Post office was giving me a rough time and the staff was wonderful and gave me a box to mail the stuff in. The stuff made it to Oklahoma but not in the same box we sent it in. I have no idea but they did a great job. The coffee in the morning is some of the best we had during our 19 days in the EU for that matter it was some of the best I have ever had. Thank you! I asked to look at some of the other rooms and because we were there during the low season they had a couple of vacant rooms and they all appeared very well appointed with the same great quality furniture and linens as the room we were in. The rooms were all in different parts of the hotel. I love this place and if I ever get back to Rome I hope to be able to stay here and if I don't I will for sure be coming by for a cup of coffee with my Romanian friends. Oh and they have gotten larger towels I guess in response to some of the reviews I have seen here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect oasis in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: bokki
Reviews.Content: Saw a review of this hotel in our local Vancouver newspaper about 6 weeks before we were due to visit Rome. I immediately emailed the hotel and within a few hours, not only did I have a reply, I had a confirmation and a great rate! The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the train station and we found it very central. We walked everywhere from the hotel. It is on the 3rd floor of a building that houses one other hotel (on another floor) and some private residences. The family that runs the place is very helpful and friendly. The breakfasts were good as was the coffee - your choice of espresso, capuccino etc. There is a lovely little walkway from one side of the hotel to the other which is outdoors and has a few tables and chairs there. One afternoon, we bought some wine, bread, olives, cheese etc and had a lovely little picnic - they kindly supplied us with wine glasses! We only paid 100 Euro per night including the breakfast. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet place, good location”
Reviews.Author: danandmaya
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend oceania, we stayed there last year on our honeymoon. The rooms are clean and spacious and quiet. It is a cosy little hotel on the 4th floor of a building (with an elevator ofcourse). We stayed there for a whole week and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is 10 minutes walk from the the train station but on the north western side of it so it is a safe area to walk at night. All main attractions are accessible by foot 20 mintutes walk. Anna was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: annof2manyhorses
Reviews.Content: Best things about this little hotel: Anna!!!! Yummy coffee Outside terrace with wifi Great location Air conditioning Bathroom towels, I loved them!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: jewliweb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Oceania was in a great location, close to the Termini train station but on a quiet side street. The service was excellent and the coffee was as good as Rick Steve's said it would be. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with family”
Reviews.Author: mfranfam
Reviews.Content: After staying at a hotel in Paris that was highly rated, we were afraid what might be in store for us at this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised. After being completely ripped off by the cab driver who charged us 50 Euros to get here from the airport (found out that it should have been closer to 30 Euro, so watch this) we arrived to a hotel that is on the 3rd floor. We took the small elevator up and entered the lobby. It was the first time we felt cool all day. Paradise already! We were greeted by a gentleman who was doing some repairs, but he quickly showed us where we could sit down. After a few minutes, Anna arrived. We had requested that we be able to check in early, and she informed us our room was ready. She took us there and showed us the beautifully decorated room and its amenities. She asked us if we needed anything else. We asked if she could make reservations for us at the Borghese Gallery. She did!! She also gave us a map, and marked out all the places we wanted to go. She advised us on her favorite place for dinner, which was wonderful. The entire staff was wonderful, especially Anna, Radu and Liliana. A few other things. I saw mentioned in other reviews that a few people were not happy about the "oversized kitchen towels" that were given as bath towels. I LOVED these towels. They are beautiful, high priced and top quality Italian linens. They are absorbent, and perfect for hot climates. They dry quickly. I think if people could go to another country and enjoy the differences (what has worked for hundreds, if not thousands of years) instead of trying to compare everything to what they are used to, they would find their trip a much better experience. I am thankful for all the new experiences. If I wanted it to be America, I could travel closer to home! One last thing, out internet service was spotty, and usually had to go out into the patio to have it work well,but again, adapt! The patio is a lovely place to sit outside and visit with others. Have a glass of wine and relax!

Reviews.Title: “A safe hotel, but not very Italian”
Reviews.Author: pharmamama54
Reviews.Content: Hotel Oceania is well located in Rome, with a short walk to just about everything a tourist would want to see. Our room was just as advertised. Air - conditioned, TV (with only 3 channels), very clean. The clientele is very American, mainly because of the endorsement by Rick Steves. If you are looking for a more international setting, I would say that this hotel is not for you. It is interesting to note that that the breakfast is basically all pre-packaged food. No fruit or yogurt in sight. The towels are dish towels not bath towels. Also, we only had a floor (shower) mat for one day. I asked for one several times, to no avail. My friend and I were charged extra euros to have our morning coffee in our room. Additionally you only pay the 158 euros if you are paying cash, other wise it is 178 euros for the room we were using. Neither the coffee up charge or the credit card up charge were told to us by the hotel staff. Really, this explanation would be very helpful at check in.

Reviews.Title: “A great place as long as you stay in the newer rooms”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalCruiser
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel from Rick Steves' guide to Rome, and stayed for 3 nights, then left for Tuscany and came back for our last night before returning home. Our first stay was fine because we stayed in the newer area of the hotel. The hotel itself is just the 3rd floor of a random building. The staff was very helpful and the owner, Stefano, made us feel welcome. They serve a nice continental breakfast in the mornings. Free WiFi is available in the public areas (and apparently some rooms, but not ours). Drawbacks: the towels were like small or large tablecloths, although they did absorb water. On our second one-day visit, we were in one of the older rooms--they gave us a bigger room with an extra bed (which we didn't need), but the shower was just a curtained off area of the tiny bathroom. If you weren't careful, the shower was pouring down on the toilet (more like a being on a boat than in a modern hotel). Again, however, the staff was extremely helpful when we had a problem. I would stay there again but I would make sure we had a newer room. By the way, there is no restaurant, spa, room service or swimming pool, but the review keeps getting rejected when I mark those things "not sure."

Reviews.Title: “We'll go back when we're in Rome again.”
Reviews.Author: RetiredSpanishProf
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in May, 2011 and really enjoyed it. The location is excellent, on a quiet side street just off the Piazza della Repubblica, close to the metro and a step-on, step-off city tour bus stop. We were able to easily reach the principal city sights from there. Our room was large and very well appointed (and I love that 1940s style elevator to get you there!) The staff was excellent, very helpful. (I had trouble backing up some photos from my camera to a flash drive and they assisted me.) There are a number of very good restaurants nearby so you don’t have to fight the tourist hordes around the Spanish Steps or the Fountain of Trevi. We’ll go back when we’re in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ddshay1
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, the room was wonderful and an overall great experience! We stayed in a junior suite our 1st 5 nights and then returned for our last night in Rome and stayed in a quad. Staff was available 24/7 and very helpful and friendly. Has free internet and a great terrace where many of the guests gather to chat in the evening. Within walking distance of just about everything. Shops and restaurants are just 1 block away. Great place for a family to stay!

Reviews.Title: “not what it use to be, not worth $260.00 per night”
Reviews.Author: coco5222
Reviews.Content: let me start by giving you all the positive things about the Hotel Oceania... it is a quaint hotel on the 3rd floor of an old building near the train station. the rooms and beds are comfortable, and most of the staff is very helpful. upon arrival the room was clean and well prepared. from that point it went down hill. on the 3rd day we had not cups in the bathroom, and by the last 2 evenings, we had no soap (good thing we brought our own.) there were days when housekeeping would just leave the pillow cases on the bed for us to put on. granted, they were clean, but... we had a corner room, 24, that had 2 great big windows, thankfully because the A/C was not working. we have stayed at this hotel before, but will not again. additionally, know that if you a paying with your debit card, there is an additional 20 euro per night that is charged you, so the rate quoted is ONLY cash. and was surely not worth the $260.00 (178. Euro) we were charged. additionally, the coffee is not made fresh per cup like "papa" use to.

Reviews.Title: “Very Quaint, great location family run business.”
Reviews.Author: Bobby1505
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is extremely central to all main attractions with some being in the next street and others a short walk away. There are restaurants nearby and a supermarket (Dspar) off the next corner on the main street for any items you may need. It is on the third floor of an old building, however, all units are very fresh, clean and have all amenties you may wish for. (heating, cooling,...) There is a beautiful little old fashioned lift that fits two people and a suitcase at one time. Lovely little outdoor verandah sitting area and good breakfast included. Internet is by one computer near the breakfast area and tends to be a little slow, however, we found the internet across Italy is not that great and is very slow. A bit behind the times with this service in all areas. Travelling with a child we ask for another bed and was given two small rooms and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and quiet place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: brodyman5
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights this May and found the staff to be very helpful, the interior balcony to be a great place to relax with fellow travelers. Wine and beer were available onsite. The rooms were very clean and quiet. Beds were the best. Discount for cash. Would definitely return. Showers a but small but modern. All in all, great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drowninginyears
Reviews.Content: What can I say about a hotel in Rome? This was like two floors of a building on the 3rd and 4th. There was a lift but it was very small. Since we were with a Rick Steves tour it was tough hauling ourselves and luggage up the stairs. There just isn't much to say about because there is not much more than your room and a sitting area which is the only place you can find internet access. There was a nice Italian continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lubomir61
Reviews.Content: We came to Rome to explore this amazing city and were looking for a hotel which would give us great location, clean, comfortable room and a quiet place to re-energize ourselves. Hotel Oceania gave us everything we looked for. Stefano and his staff were simply amazing, polite, warm, professional, assertive and always found time for our question, request or advise. Thanks everyone at Oceania, you made our stay in Eternal City unforgettable. Lou Novosad North Vancouver, BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “Charming retreat”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideDiana
Reviews.Content: Recently had a memorable stay at the Hotel Oceania, which is a perfect gem, conveniently located near the Stazione Termini and the Via Nazionale shopping precinct. Stefano Loreti and his staff are wonderful and they go out of their way to help you to have a pleasant and relaxing stay. After an exhausting long-haul flight, the charm of this boutique hotel was like a soothing balm. The decor is elegant and appealing. The continental breakfast is delightful. The Oceania will be my first port of call for subsequent visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “All-around great place”
Reviews.Author: Trippie85
Reviews.Content: - Great little hotel in a convenient location, near the train station and a popular train stop - Front desk is staffed 24/7 and they are wonderful, very accommodating - Rooms/bathrooms are small but very clean - Breakfast every morning included - Free computer and internet access, which is always nice All-around great, quaint place to stay. Would stay there again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, comfortable rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: PB_RB_761
Reviews.Content: Wonderful week in Rome made even better by the helpful, friendly staff of the Oceania. Good location, clean & well kept facilities. R&P&friends

Reviews.Title: “nice decor, but rather so-so in every other sense.”
Reviews.Author: Madeleineshi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a nice building, The entrance and corridor are done in an elegant way. But the room itself is very plain. It has all the basic amenities. But the sheets and towels, plus the room itself have smell of stale air. Plus the internet didn't really work. Its an Ok place to just sleep overnight in Rome, but I would not rave about it or make any strong recommendation. There are several other places in the vicinities which would offer more or charge less.

Reviews.Title: “Great location all around.”
Reviews.Author: keyhole70
Reviews.Content: After having our trip scheduled for April cancelled because of the volcano we arrived at the Oceania in October. The wait was worth it. The hotel is gracious but not over board. Delicious breakfasts and perfect location.It will be our go to place in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay -- Nothing to Complain About”
Reviews.Author: Toscanabella
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 very lovely nights at the Hotel Oceania. As a group of foreign students we were greeted very warmly by Anna and the other staff. The rooms were very tastefully furnished, spacious and immaculately clean. Breakfast was absolutely delcious and it was great to always be greeted by a warm smile every morning. The hotel is on the 3rd floor and has a lift, which is great. Also, the neighbourhood is extremely safe and nice compared to other areas of Rome. We felt more than comfortable walking around at night. There are quite a few nice restaurants around, and most of the major sights are within walking distance. The hotel is within walking distance of Termini, but it is quite a long walk if you have lots of baggage. Overall, we were extremely happy with our stay, would highly recommend it to others and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Floor - Nice Hotel and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: butterflyman
Reviews.Content: For $129 cash Euros, we were happy with the Oceania. It has a tiny elevator to the 3rd floor, but it makes the visit quaint. It's also close to buses and many stores and shops. The only trouble we had was that they turn off the AC during the day and they don't tell you. I had to get some help to turn it back on. Some rooms have been updated - try and get one if they're available. A nice Continental breakfast and very friendly people. Watch out for the ride from the airport to the hotel - shuttles will gouge you. - that's true of everything in Rome - find the price first and then do some calculations to make sure it's fair. A cab ride might be the safest, especially if you can share it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: danstric7104
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a few days of vacation in Rome. Although the hotel is very close to Termini train station, the neighborhood surrounding the hotel felt safe when we came in at night after dark from the bus or metro. The entrance was not obvious by American standards, but it was not that difficult to find. We travel light, so the tiny elevator was not a problem. Morning breakfast was good and those who ran the hotel were very helpful and friendly. We were introduced to the owner upon our arrival. This is always a good sign. The room was outstanding, newly remodeled with fabric wall coverings. We would recommend this hotel without reservations, especially if you are looking for a quiet getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: travelishealing
Reviews.Content: The staff of the hotel are very friendly, very accommodating, and very helpful. Rome is quite overwhelming so it was nice to come "home" to friendly faces. The free wifi didn't work in my room, but performed well in the comfortable common areas. The hotel is very popular with Americans and had 3 TV stations all in English. Unfortunately, our room wasn't quite as lovely as the staff. The air conditioning worked moderately on full blast at the coldest temperature, but never really cooled the room off. The carpet in the room was a huge turn off, but it appears from the pictures that other rooms have tile. The bathroom was very basic but needed a few basic fixes (shower floor was damaged and the shower doors don't close all the way). I'm positive that if we've had another room, we'd have been happier. But the location and staff are top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good 3-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TigerDiner
Reviews.Content: Oceania is a very well-managed, tourist-friendly hotel. Like many small hotels the rooms conform to the space around them and are not American-style. Oceania's rooms and bathrooms are well decorated, clean, and comfortable. The staff was terrific. Breakfast is included and nicely presented (although a little heavy on sweet items). We stayed twice (at the beginning and end of out Italy vacation) and were very pleased both times. Location is good but not in the middle of the favorite tourist spots. It is a short walk to Rome's main rail station. Rome subway is also very close. I think that Oceania is a very good bet in the 3-star rating group,

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gad26
Reviews.Content: This was such a charming and romantic bed and breakfast! The location was so close to the major train station (about a 7 minute walk)! It was also very close to all the main Rome attractions (about 15 to 20 minutes to forum). The staff was so friendly and willing to answer our questions! The rooms were so nice with big comfy beds, A/C, and lots of room! There was a nice patio where you could enjoy a drink or do your daily planning. The breakfast was also amazing with a large spread of pastries! We had a great experience here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: ChiantiSoul
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed only one night before a flight the next day, and greatly enjoyed this gem of a hotel. The location is excellent (we walked to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps and to a wonderful restaurant for dinner, Osteria Romana), the service was impeccable and the rooms were clean and spacious, and had a mini refrigerator (not a stocked mini bar). We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, excellent service: worth the money in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NotLostWanderer
Reviews.Content: After having stayed both here (Hotel Oceania) and at Bellesuite/ Hotel Adler in Rome (just around the corner from each other) on the same trip, I can't imagine how this hotel is rated lower than Bellesuite. Hotel Oceania was a haven for us in Rome, which is dusty and hot. The room (#16) and bathroom were spotless and quite large for European standards. We even got wifi since we were close to the reception hall (although we never heard any noise from the reception). The bed was comfortable, we had a nice view of the terrace from our window, and the hotel staff were great. Radu, who is there a lot, was very accommodating and friendly. The location of the hotel is ideal-- the area feels safe, and is within a 7-10 minute walk from Termini station. It was worth the price difference (compared to Hotel Adler/ Bellesuite) to stay here, given the cleanliness of the room. The breakfast is typical Italian breakfast (sweets, bread and coffee), served in a beautiful dining area. There is also a computer with internet access available. Would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: Boonetrav
Reviews.Content: Oceania was a delight.Staff was friendly and anxious to help. Room was large with King bed and private bath. Breakfast was very good for European. Plan to return here on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Themitchells6
Reviews.Content: Very closely located to the main train station in Rome. It is easy to miss, as it is on the 4th floor of the building (5th floor is you are from the US as they start with floor zero). Our room was great, breakfast was adequate, the staff were very friendly, knowledgable and helpful. We did not encounter anyone but Americans staying there - not sure if this is because it was a Rick Steve's recommendation or not. Only negative was the W-Fi - very iffy - don't think they had enough bandwidth. All in all a very good bargain and good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel...will stay again”
Reviews.Author: pamraynor
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with a lift and air conditioning. The rooms are very clean, staff is very friendly, and it is quiet. There is a computer for quests that you can use until 9pm. Do not eat at the restuarant Da Giovanni that they recommend. It was a very bad experience and the worst food we had on our 16 day trip. Other than that, will stay again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Better than just basic”
Reviews.Author: RayPays
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before heading home after 3 weeks traveling all over the country. This is a basic hotel. We liked the quaintness of it and the beds were comfortable. Wi-Fi worked well. Didnt stay long enough to sample the breakfast but the bar in the afternoon was lively and it was close to several places to eat on Nazionale, as well, attractions and sights are walking distance in the core area. 1 block from Piazza Republica. Kind of tricky to find with a taxi as the street it is on goes one way for several blocks and then 1 way the other way for a couple blocks. Nothing special but clean, quiet and comfortable at a relatively affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place! Very quiet & comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: scubagirlkelley
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms are a decent size. We stayed there for six nights while we explored Rome. The metro or cab stands are very close and convenient, making all the sights very easy to reach. If you were energetic most things were within walking distance. Staff was always willing to call & get reservations or offer any other help needed. Decent restaurant choices available nearby for those nights you wanted to stay close. Breakfast was good - in fact, the best hot chocolate I had this trip (out of five hotels). I would wish for hard or soft boiled eggs with breakfast, just so as to get some protein besides the cheese and liverwurst (which I won't eat!), but none of the hotels we stayed at offered eggs, so maybe they don't do that in Italy anymore (last time I was here was 15 years ago). I especially appreciated that the rooms were VERY quiet, as I am quite a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice for families”
Reviews.Author: ParkCitiesMom
Reviews.Content: We rented the family suite - two large rooms with bathrooms connected by a foyer and it provided the space that we needed for our two teenagers. It was very reasonably priced for two rooms. Ask for the Rick Steves rate. The hotel is staffed by friendly, helpful personnel. The breakfast was very good with unlimited hot chocolate for the kids and cappacino's for the adults. The rooms a bit frayed around the edges but the quality of the queen bed was very good. The location of the hotel is not the best as the neighborhood is non descript and lacks charm. If your looking for neighborhood character, I would suggest finding a small hotel in the Spanish Steps area.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms, Good Price, Good Breakfast, Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RodgerOlsen
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was a 10 minute walk from the main Termini Station in Rome, and it saved me a bundle on transportation. I took the commuter train in from the Airport for 11 Euro instead of the 70 Euro cab ride. You can also get the bus (about a block from the hotel) back to the terminal and go anywhere in Rome for 4 euros a day. The rooms were "vintage", on the third floor of a building with a lift rather than an elevator, and the room keys were skeleton keys that could be picked with a hairpin, but I would stay there again. The bathrooms were all new, the beds were large enough for an overweight 6' 2" American. the place was very clean and the staff helpful. The door locks were not a problem as the staff is always on duty and the main doors are locked at night. The rooms and hallways were obviously a conversion of what was a spacious private apartment about a hundred years ago. It made a nice, cozy, atmosphere. The only problem was that the huge doors on the ground floor close about 9:30 and you have to buzz the hotel to let you in. One night the staff was a little sleepy and I had to buzz both hotels in the building several times before one of them buzzed the door open. The price as good for Rome. I paid 80 Euro a night and the hotel billed my Visa in dollars so that I didn't have to pay the foreign currency exchange fee.

Reviews.Title: “Was thrilled with Hotel Oceania”
Reviews.Author: cbader1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Oceania with my wife for three nights during a trip for our 20th anniversary. First time in Rome. We will stay here if (make that when...) we return to Rome. The rooms were clean, comfortable and pleasant. The staff was wonderful and extremely helpful - they directed us to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and got us reservations for the Borghese Gallery. The free breakfast in the mornings was great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Hamachi_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Oceania Mar 09 and it was the last stop on my heavily budgeted trip. The guidebooks made it sound like it's near the train station and it may not be a safe neighborhood. It's actually across the street from the Ministry of Defense. Even when I walked there at night as a single female I felt perfectly safe. The Metro is not very far and there are pharmacies, restaurants and tourist stops in the area. The elevator is tiny and rickety and if someone doesn't shut the door on another floor it won't run. Expecting a lot of walking in Europe this wasn't a problem to just take the stairs. When shown my room I almost double-checked my rate. Absolute luxury for a girl staying in the barest rooms across Europe. The room was massive to me with nice furnishings and opulently decorated. The bathroom was beautifully tiled and clean and had great big towels. For the included breakfast you sit down to a place setting already with a huge brioche roll and options of Presidente butter, jams, pates and Nutella. Freshly brewed coffee, tea, juices, hot chocolate. Pastries, breads and cakes. Lots of carb loading for the day! Outside the breakfast room is a computer free for use. The staff was always around and helpful and smiling. Like all the other hotels on my trip, you leave your room key in a basket when leaving each day. Feels a little unsafe but since they all seem to do it I just hoped for the best and all was okay! No question I would stay here again. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, dated, poor reccomendations”
Reviews.Author: angelofmercy
Reviews.Content: I paid 158 euros per night, They insisted on cash or they would increase the price by 20 euros per night. The hotel is on the third floor of an old building. The view of the courtyard looks like the ghetto. The elevator is so old it looks gothic and is broken half the time and you have to hike the 3 floors; The beds are hard. The towels are thin table clothes. They actually did dry you off. When we left for the day, they would turn off our ac, so it would be hot on our return and take hours to cool off. We were close to the breakfast room, so they woke us up at 7:30 very day. The shower was like a small space ship, not a good thing, the strange doors were broken. They never replaced the soap. I had to ask for some everyday. The carpet was old without any padding. The staff was helpful and could speak english. Most of the patrons spoke english and that was nice. The location is good and our room was quiet. Rome is a crazy city. The driving is nuts. You feel like you are going to be run over. Even in a cross walk with a green light, be careful. The fumes of city burned my lungs. I felt like I was being ripped off at every turn. The hotel referred us to a place for diner, which served pork that was rotten. I didn't eat it. They never asked if i liked it. The Romans hate americans and think we are stupid. The hotel referred us to a laundry. They charged us 40 euros for one small load. When we got it back to the hotel, we realized it was still wet. My daughter asked them to dry clean one pair of her jeans and they washed them, the seams and pockets were still wet. it should have cost no more than 15 euros. The breakfast was bread and sweets. The cappucinos were very good. I felt this hotel was overpriced for what it was. I did not like having to go to the atm 3 times to get them cash. If I were to go to rome again, I would stay out of the insane town and take the termini in. Don't pay for a tour at the Vatican, it is a total ripoff. Use the 110 bus for sightseeing, it comes every 10 mins. The staff is more helpful than most other places, they downloaded our plane tickets, which I appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: mendiratta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights Sep 3- Sep 5 the room had a very clean look, decent size, with a OK sized, fully fitted bathroom for 200 euro in cash- 100 euro per night. The location of this hotel is great, just 15 minutes walk to Roma Termini and 10 minute walk to Republica metro station. The hotel is on via Firenze a safe street right of Via Nationazale. The bus stop is right in front of a Mc Donald where you can catch 40 Express to Vatican and bus 64 which takes to Pantheon- Largo Argentina- Trevi fountain, Navona fountain and Campi Di Fiori. The Spanish steps and Colloseum can be done by the Metro from the Termini or Republica stops. Roman Forum is 15-20 minute walk. The hotel staff is good- speaks good English. The bathroom leaks water crazily from the shower making the bathroom real wet. The breakfast is a shame and sucks big time. It is only offered b/w 8am and 10 pm – unreasonable for early checkouts like I had to do for a train to catch. The only saving grace was their cappuccino which was decent- the day I happen to catch their breakfast. The internet in the lobby has a 9am – 9pm timeline even when the staff is present 24 hours, which is a bit odd to me. The hotel elevator is not always working as often people forgot closing the doors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkDaisy18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Oceania in the beginning of September with my sister and we had a nice stay there. The staff is very friendly, nice and helpful. They arranged a taxi for us to the airport our last day too. For a budget hotel (found through Rick Steves' guidebook), we found it to be very nice. We stayed in two different rooms as we began our trip in Rome, then left to Florence for several days and then back to Rome before flying home to the U.S. Both rooms were fine. The first room's decor needed to be update a bit (wallpaper & rug) but the room was quiet, a good size and the bathroom was a good size as well. The second room had nicer decor, but faced the street so it was a little noiser. However, they have wooden window shutters to block out some of the outside noise at night so it was fine for us. The breakfast was pastries with great coffee. As breakfast doesn't begin until 8:00 a.m., we missed it our last day there and my sister was disappointed that she missed out on their great coffee. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Termini station and walkable to everything else. It is on the same block as the Ministry of Defense so we felt safe there. The one thing that should be noted about the location is that the block does not have the building numbers in sequence, so we had trouble at first finding the right building. It is actually at the end of the block (closer to Via Settembre). I would definitely consider staying there again and would recommend it to anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: durke
Reviews.Content: This is a cozy, tucked-away retreat from the busy streets of Rome. Our room was quiet and the owner was attentive and helpful (spoke English well). The breakfast room is a warm and inviting setting with a decent variety of food. The bed was not very comfortable (although I am extremely picky) but every other part of our stay was enjoyable. We stayed at this location three nights and were able to walk comfortably to all major sights without problem. I will not rave about this hotel, but I found nothing materially wrong with it either. This is a typical 2-3 star hotel and makes up for its lack of "grandness" by having a fantastically helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “as Rick Steves described it !!”
Reviews.Author: jclevoy
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this clean, quiet, family run budget hotel. Loved the lift and thought it added character to our stay. Rick Steves was right in that they serve the yummiest cappuccino's in the morning with breakfast. The only downside is that they serve breakfast no earlier than 8am and on the last morning of our stay we had to miss it in order to catch our train. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, quaint and comfortable hotel, can walk to train station”
Reviews.Author: LuccaWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night but will surely stay here when again in Rome. Large old room with great renovated bathroom. Very clean and comfortable. Staff couldn't be nicer or more helpful. Even packed us a take away breakfast because we had to leave early.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel with nice rooms and bath rooms”
Reviews.Author: tmleahey
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. the room was nicely appointed and had a real double bed not just two twins pushed together. We were in room #15, it was very quiet. I liked having a safe and a mini frig. Staff at the desk was very friendly and helpful. We never got breakfast because we had a tour of the Vatican tour one morning and had to catch our flight the next. Coffee or something available before 8 AM would have been nice. For 158 euros, it seemed slightly pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: italyloverHouston
Reviews.Content: We, too, saw the info about this hotel in Rick Steves book, and it did not disappoint. The staff was warm and helpful, the breakfasts were perfect and the rooms were clean and nicely furnished. We were able to walk to the Spanish Steps in about 10-15 minutes, and found great restaurants about 5 minutes away on main streets. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: jwobkk
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was ok – I liked the value and the location but found the space a bit drab. I didn’t get to try the much raved about breakfast since the serving window is so short (8am to 10am). Service would be improved if they started breakfast service at 7am to accommodate people traveling and early risers. The beds were comfortable and I particularly liked the pillows. The bathroom was nice with a good shower although the thin towels are a bit odd. The staff is helpful with directions and making dinner reservations. Free internet is available to guests although it was painfully slow while I was using it. The location is good - a short 5 to 10 minute walk to Termini. Fine overall but I’m not sure why Rick Steves raves about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: IrishTexasAggie
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome several times, but this is by far my favorite hotel. The location is only a 5-10 walk from the train station but on a quiet, safe street. The rooms were clean and spacious, the bathrooms were great, and the staff was helpful. This will be the place I stay from now on when visiting Rome! The only negatives were the odd, thin towels. However, this really wasn't a big deal!

Reviews.Title: “Our home base in Italy”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel16
Reviews.Content: Hotel Oceania was our home away from home during our 8 day Italy trip. We stayed 2nights in the beginning of our trip and 1 last night before heading back to the U.S. It was an ideal place to stay to help us get our bearings before driving to Tuscany/Umbria. The staff is friendly and helpful. Our flight arrived early in the morning and we arrived at the hotel before 10:00 am. We were so glad that our room was ready when we arrived. Once we got into our room, we immediately felt at home. The hotel location is also very ideal. We walked to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon. The only time we took the train is when we went to the Vatican. Train station is about 5 minute easy walk from hotel. We also walked to Termini station where we picked up our rental car. Hotel Oceania has the perfect combination of comfort, location, and price. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located for all attractions and transport. Friendly and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: mopseyLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with our two boys 14 and 12 years. The hotel is on the third floor of an attractive building. You can walk the marble staircase to the entrance or take the lift, so the third floor location is not an issue. Our family room was spacious and spotless complete with private shower, toilet etc. Breakfast is included and is WONDERFUL! Fabulous cakes, pates, fresh bread etc. The hotel is excellently presented and the staff were all friendly, accomodating and welcoming. Each evening we returned to our room to find the beds made and fresh towels etc provided. A lovely treat! There is a bar also, rare in hotels of this price range but much needed after a long days walking! Excellently located for the metro (five stops to vatican). we walked to all other attractions, colleseum, steps, trevi fountain etc - very central but also very safe to walk around hotel area at night as near m.o.d therefore excellent security. Stay here and you will feel you are in 'Roma' from the moment you put down your case. One tip. Order your taxi from the hotel - get a fixed price - otherwise the taxi firm make it up as they go along. Can't think of a single thing I would change about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel with Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: kaldonia
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous booking here because it actually had vacancy for 7 rooms on short notice. What a blessing for us. I'm not certain this will happen again. I'll probably need to book a little further in advance. Very warm and supportive staff. Perfect location for those of us using trains and walking the sites. Not for the glitzy or posh crowd but I could see family travelers here. Plan on paying in cash for cheaper rate. Our room was quite large compared to other European hotel rooms. We had a room facing Via Septembre and not excessively noisy. The hotel is on the 3rd floor of it's building. There is a small lift for those days you've left no energy from walking all of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KathyBobPlay
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great place to stay for a great price. Discovered it thru Rick Steve's TV show on PBS. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and accomodating. Our room was immaculate, comfortable, good size with private bathroom and shower. Towels were top quality and very absorbent !!!!!!!!! Loved listening to the opera rehearsals from the opera house on the first floor--not at all inconvenient. The elevator was small, but worked just fine, after all, what can one expect from such a beautiful, old building!!!!!!!! European breakfast with the wonderful warm rolls and top quality cakes and the best cappuccino, was a great start to the day. Close to metro. BRAVO, HOTEL OCEANIA. Kathy /Bob Florida, U.S.A

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: kcbCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Oceania - it was the last hotel on our "Tour of Italy" and it was a nice way to end our trip. The staff was very friendly; they responded to emails prior to our arrival promptly and there's someone at the desk 24/7 which was wonderful to know. The high-speed internet / wireless was a welcome amenity as was the elevator! Our room was quite spacious (we were on the interior so our view was of a courtyard with laundry often hanging, but it didn't bother us as we were out all day anyway.) There was a comfortable "TV" room with couches and a nice television, as well as a small bar. Breakfast left a little to be desired; although the coffee was the best we had - the options for food weren't great; rolls, and lots of cakes/torts. No cereal or yogurt options. The location was walkable from Roma Terminal train station and an easy 10 minute walk to the subway that took us to the major sights. I highly recommend Lord Byron Pub just down the street on the corner of Via Firenze and Nazionale. All in all - a wonderful value, good location, and friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Chrssher
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family (2 adults, 7 and 4 yr old boys) as well as a large group of friends (6 other adults, 3 teenagers and 2 other children) and it was a great base for our Roman adventure. It can be difficult to find rooms that will sleep four comfortably; no issues with that at all. The room was HUGE; there was a King bed, additional twin bed plus a cot for the 4 yr old. Everything spotlessly clean, but not fancy. The bathroom was a bit cramped but completely functional - have to get used to the idea you could essentially sit on the toilet and take a shower at the same time but it was ok! Towels were different - more like tablecloths! They were in pristine condition, spotless and replaced daily however. Breakfast was a nice mix of cheeses, pastries and rolls; you are offered your choice of juices, as well as coffee and/or hot chocolate. Service was friendly and helpful; times adequate and food variety very good. The espresso and coffee machine in the breakfast room is available at other times as well; mgr nice enough to bring us coffee in the afternoon. They also sell beer, wine, etc in the afternoon and evening. There is a nice lobby available, as well as the porch outside near the elevator. Be aware: this hotel is on the third floor and there is a very small elevator available. We had someone on crutches in our party and it was perfectly adequate but it is a hike up 5 floors of steps! Would recommend; they are amazing accomodating for families and groups. Great value; good location in a very safe neighborhood. Lots of options for eating, shopping etc and walking distance to the Termini and subway stations.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecopunk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Oceania is a wonderful little hotel on a quiet street but surrounded by lots of restaurants and shops within 1/2 block. The staff is wonderful; they easily agreed to keep my luggage while I flew to Bari on business and retrieved my jewelry which I accidently left in a room while away. The price was very reasonable; the room was very clean, and there was internet access. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: jcp07
Reviews.Content: I had e-mailed the Oceania about our 6AM arrival at the Rome airport and was told that check-in time was 1PM. Imagine our excitement when we arrived at the hotel around 8AM and our room was ready. We had breakfast and then a nap and were ready to enjoy Rome. The location was a short walk to the Coliseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. The staff was always cordial and helpful. My husband and I were a little concerned about staying in a hotel that was on only one floor of a multi-story building, but it was wonderful. We stayed in two other hotels of the same type, but this was by far our favorite. I felt that, while the hotel was warm with an elegant touch, we were living a little bit like locals. While it didn't bother us, some might not like the fact that there is only one computer for internet use, and it can only be used during certain hours. The breakfast was among the better we had in Italy - especially the warm rosetta rolls, which we had never had before. The bath sheets were fantastic. I wish I had asked to buy one. If you are looking for a typical chain hotel experience, Hotel Oceania might not be for you, but I recommend it highly. If we ever make it back to Rome, Hotel Oceania is where we'll stay. Thanks Anna, Roberto, Stefano, and the rest of the staff for making our first trip to Rome a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: YolandaGolightly
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Oceania was for the last two nights of a three-week trip in Italy. It was a haven in the very energetic city of Rome. The room was lovely and spacious, and the price of 100 Euros was excellent, especially for the convenient location. We walked to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and Piazza Navonna, but took a cab back! We booked it because it was near Galeria Borghese, but the gallery was closed the day we were able to go. Breakfast was lovely with hot bread and a variety of pastries. The staff was helpful, although one dear young woman spoke limited English. We communicated, though, and she was eager to please and help with reservations, etc. Our telephone didn't work, and she traded it out for one that did. The elevator is small (but adequate) and is a little tricky, but this is an ancient building, and we were just pleased to have an elevator at all!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Allie_in_OZ
Reviews.Content: We would not recommend you stay here unless you have exhausted other possibilities. Whilst our hotel room was clean and spacious, we felt we were severely overcharged for our hotel room, even in Rome. The price quoted was substantially more than what is advertised on their website and does not offer value for money. The Hotel's brochure advertised a telephone, tv, bath in the room and a laundry service. We were actually looking forward to these things at the end of long-sightseeing days but once we checked into our room, realised the room had not one of these items! The price we paid for our room and the fact that this is meant to be a 3star hotel made us feel absolutely conned by this hotel. We also asked about their laundry service and were given directions to a laundromat about 15 mins walk away (which is fine by us but just another leading mis-advertisement by the hotel). Breakfast time put the icing on the cake, as it was coffee, juice and a bread roll; not good enough for 190 euro per night!! and not sufficient enough to start traveller's off for a day of sightseeing. We have stayed at 2 star hotels, pensions and backpacker's hostels throughout Europe which have put on the works with beautiful breakfasts and offered far more than this 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chet_Maryland
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here twice during our trip to Italy this spring. The rooms are variable, our first room was decent sized but the shower in the bathroom was "interesting" a shower head and curtain in front of the basin, but ok. The TV didnt work (crisis for daughter great for me :-)) The staff was always friendly and helpful in getting to places. A lot of help making train reservations until I figured out Trenitalia. The second stay was our last night in Italy and the room was great, large roomy shower and bathroom with comfortable beds and a great room air conditioner. Both or us agreed it was the best overall room of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff, Comfortable Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: FantasticItaly08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 2008 and really enjoyed it. PROS: The hotel is at an excellent location, close to the Termini. This made it really easy to get around town. The area felt safe with the guards near by for the government buildings across the street. The hotel room was spacey, the bathrooms nice, and the beds comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Found breakfast to be pretty nice as well, but cold. Great pasteries and the BEST coffee from a hotel that I had the entire trip. CONS: Lots of steps or a super small and slow elevator in order to reach the hotel. Only 1 internet station and they only keep it open during certain times of day. We found the place through Rick Steves and contacted the property directly for booking and paid with Euros. Everything worked out well. Would definitely stay here again if we make it back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: dcgoldeneagle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in July and it was absolutely wonderful. The room was large, clean and the air conditioning was COLD. The bathroom was very roomy for European standards as well. I wouldn't have changed a thing. Staff was perfect. Breakfast and coffee were superb and the location was great. Is the elevator small...yes but if that is the only complaint then get over it! Next time I am in Rome I will be at the Oceania!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great value!”
Reviews.Author: mcr237
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well worth the money. It was located in a great part of the city and just a few blocks from the Termini Station. The staff was extremely helpful and nice and the rooms were clean and spacious (for Europe). Breakfast was very good and included freshly brewed coffee, bread, cakes, and pastries. The shower was a bit small but as I traveled through Italy, this seemed to be pretty normal. I can't say enough good things about the staff. They knew which buses to take to get basically anywhere in Rome and provided us with a great map. Although the hotel is close to Termini, I'd recommend taking a cab to the hotel or at least mapping out the route ahead of time because getting there on foot can be a bit tricky (and the cobblestone streets aren't very friendly when carrying luggage). But once you see how to get there it is very easy! I'd highly recommend this place and will stay there again when I go back to Rome. Oh yeah, one more thing, don't be afraid of the elevator. It is a little crazy looking but don't judge the hotel by this. This is a really great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great price”
Reviews.Author: BABSF
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel on a single floor of a multi-purpose building. The staff is lovely and very helpful. After staying in another hotel in Rome (for far more per night) where we could almost stand and touch both sides of the room, this was a marvelous little oasis. The room was very modern and the bathroom was spacious. The shower was quite large by Italian standards.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel-good deal”
Reviews.Author: sfbearSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that the Oceania Hotel was an excellent choice. The staff was very courteous and helpful, especially for restaurant recommendations. The rooms were very nice, but small-typical European hotel room. The location was much better than I thought it would be. We easily walked to the Forum , Borghese, Baths of Diocletian, Campo di Fiori. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular”
Reviews.Author: fire9883
Reviews.Content: This place was beautiful. The staff would go out of there to lend a hand to make the stay more comfortable. The rooms were spacious and excepionally clean. The only complaint that I have is that the elevator is tiny. The location of this hotel is centrally located for all of rome except for the vatican. You have to use a taxi or take the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Get ready for high prices for a hotel that is in the middle ground”
Reviews.Author: iveyslove82
Reviews.Content: Here is what I have to say about this place. Well I had a friend of mine tell me about how nice this place was, even though I looked at the reviews. I went with their opinion over what was online that I had googled. So the hotel is around 1/2 - 1 mile from the train so that was good. What was bad is you may get a taxi guy that really isn't real. Yeah, that was us. Instead of taking me to our hotel he took us on a 10min tour, and then charged us 40 Euro. BAD!!! Be careful!!! So back to the hotel. I told them in advance I had had surgery, needed some extra pillows and a extra blacket which they gave, good point. Bad point, they didn't inform me that they had construction above them going on, so if your not ready to be up at 8am you might not be a happy camper. Ask them if someone is doing construction in the building, it looks like they are tyring to do the whole building piece by piece. Below me, OPERA, yeap get ready for practices people. Lord a mercy if it wasn't one it was the other, or it might have been both. I came back through 2 weeks later because I had already reserved my room and was locked in, last night there, OPERA at night, the concert. Sleep is a good thing folks, and for what we paid, SOOOO not worth it. Location was nice but nothing else. That is what you will pay for. Its close to the trains, and the subway station. There are a few nice things around to see but its not worth what we paid. In American $$$$$ we paid about $600 for 2 nights. Not worth it at all. When it comes to the rooms, no rooms are alike, so if you have a fridge and safe in one room, it doesn't mean it will be in the next room. They had very small bathrooms, the Heat, NO DICE, the bed it was ok, and I have a bad back and am quite picky. OH and sorry I forgot to take a picture of this hotel and the rooms I stayed in. Also, the people that work there are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Italian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbbieDahl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May 2005, and it was the perfect place to start our Italy trip. The location was ideal for exploring the city, and our room was clean and comfortable. There were very few TA reviews at the time we booked, so I'm glad to the favorable reviews. There are a lot of faithful Rick Steves readers who stay here, so if being around a lot of americans on your italian vacation bothers you ... stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mrsamiller
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in Rick Steves book after the one booked through our package was disappointing. Stefano must have sensed my frustration and anxiety seeing as it was New Year's weekend in Rome and most everything was booked. He only had room for 1 night but assured me he would help us find a hotel for our last night if need be. This was great place to stay. The rooms were beautiful, the hospitality was unmatched and our experience was fabulous! We have told all of our friends about this place and it will be the ONLY place we stay when we return to Rome. It's very convienient to the metro and several other places. It's in a very safe neighborhood and we felt safe and welcomed there. This is a GREAT find. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel with a terrific staff, few amenities”
Reviews.Author: sabos93
Reviews.Content: What the Hotel Oceania lacks in ambience it makes up for in hospitality. This quaint, budget hotel is clean and comfortable with a great location and a delightful staff. The rooms are basic with firm mattresses, simple bathrooms, and basic TV. Though spacious, most of the rooms lack any real appointments. An okay place to rest but not a very desirable location for spending your downtime. Breakfast is served each morning and consists of coffee, espresso, and pastry. Internet access is available to guests from a public computer in the lobby but there is no access in the rooms. As I mentioned in the beginning, the staff are very kind and a great help when planning your Roman adventure. The will help you navigate, find transportation, and make reservations at museums and local restaurants. Aside from the wonderful staff and affordable rates, Oceania offers a nice location. The hotel is directly across the street from the Italian Ministry of Defense (this seems to keep the pick pockets away). And while not central to the city, Oceania is walking distance from Rome Termini Central Train Station, The Quirinale, and Trevi Fountain. Hearty souls that enjoy a good walk will find that they can reach Villa Borghese, the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, and perhaps even Vatican City (2 miles). Not interested in a hike? Oceania is very close to Via Barberini and the bus/train lines that can take you anywhere in Rome including the Coliseum. Rome is a dense city but easy to navigate and note a bad hike from one end to the other. So if you are looking for an affordable hotel with great service and good location. Hotel Oceania is definitely for you. If you’re looking for some creature comforts I’d look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “awesome find”
Reviews.Author: Mochilato
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in Rick Steve's Italy. This hotel is in the heart of Rome, walking distance to the Metro and to the Colloseum. We were welcomed by the concierge with an afternoon tea/coffee and biscuits at the veranda. Although there was no elevator, the concierge carried our luggages both on check-in and check-out. The beds were very comfortable and the room was small but very clean. Of course breakfast was provided. Anna is a very gracious owner who accommodated us at a moment's notice. Best of all, the rate is quite affordable. Definitely, we will keep this hotel in mind when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: erm621
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first night in Rome before moving to a hotel as part of our tour. Oceania was a very nice place and easy for us to find. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. The breakfast in the morning was good and the espresso was the best I tasted while in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: PoloM1
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3 night stay at Hotel Oceania based on a recommendation from Rick Steves. The location is definately convienent as it is a short walk from the train station which is also thier main center for Rome's subway and bus systems. Internet was available in the lobby, but was not available in the room since the wireless was not working correctly. The room was clean and the hotel was nice but our overall experience was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Oceania made the Rome experience even BETTER!”
Reviews.Author: moose1205
Reviews.Content: Prime location in the heart of Rome at a great price. It is actually located right across the street from the Ministry of Defense, so it is in a very safe location. This is a small, family run operation. Hotel staff was personable and very courteous. In fact much of the staff is made up of the family that owns the hotel. The ambiance of the hotel reflected that which was much more authentic than what you would find at a larger chain. Will DEFINITELY stay there when I make my way back to Rome. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “All in all a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: kp14
Reviews.Content: We stayed in their lovely, relatively newly redecorated room the first two nights in Italy and were charmed with the room, location, friendly staff and breakfast.
