Unfortunately they had just experienced some issues with their power running through the outlets and because of the voltage nearly caused a fire and melted our hair curling device. Could have been very dangerous. After visiting Tuscany we returned to the hotel for our last night in Italy before flying home to California and the room they gave us was old, unattractive and most importantly (for two women traveling together) the bathroom was old and so small that to use the toilet or bidet one's feet were in the shower. I would return if promised one of the newer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Indy64
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel. We found the staff very friendly, and helpful. Our room was clean and of a good size. If you want to experience true italian culture, then this family is for you. The breakfast was continental, and very good and ample. If you want scrambled eggs and bacon when you are in Europe, then stay home. If you want to enjoy the culture you are in then ask this facility for recommendations for restaurants, side trips, etc., they are more than accommodating. We will definately use this hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: EZimm44
Reviews.Content: This place is centrally located and a moderate stay, too pricey for what it is. On the 3rd floor of a apartment building with a shaky lift. The breakfast is only bread and cheese and a few pastries. Although, the staff is very nice and there is internet. AC isn't very strong and the beds are not so comfortable twins. Small bathrooms and very bare rooms. Not a terrible stay but not recommended for savvy travelers, ok for young travelers who don't plan on being in the room much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & No Bed Bug Issues!!!”
Reviews.Author: fantasticf0ur
Reviews.Content: Four members of my family stayed here in June 2007. Prior to leaving for Italy we checked TripAdvisor one more time & saw the posting about bed bugs. We figured we'd wait to get to Rome & then check the place out. If there were issues we wouldn't stay. When we got to the hotel we did check around (based on various website instructed methods) and found no indication of bed bugs. We talked to the owner who told us that there had been a problem but it had been corrected. So we decided to stay. Our room was clean and large. We stayed for three nights and had absoluely no incidences of beg bugs. The hotel staff was friendly & efficient. The location of the hotel suited our needs (near the termini, etc). I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and/or at another of their locations in Pienze.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs...”
Reviews.Author: kellyoatlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in March 2007- Second day in to the trip, I noticed about 8 bug bites on my neck. By the time we left, I had about 40 bites on my neck and arms and I know I got bed bugs from this place. I don't remember the specific room number, but it was on the side where the TV and the reception desk are (not the side where breakfast is served) and it was the last room on the left overlooking the courtyard, not the street. I went to the doctor right when I got home, and they confirmed they were bedbugs. I am certain I got them from this hotel especially now that I have seen other people complaining of the same thing. It is a shame because the location was great (close to termini) and the room was not bad. I contacted them through e-mail upon returning home, but they did not get back to me. I hope they address the problem because we found the recommendation in our Lonely Planet book and I know it is in Rick Steves, too.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Cali_Cal
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed here, we really enjoyed it, although I got multiple bug bites. I didn't know what they were, and didn't think it was related to the hotel. I recently stayed here again and woke up at 3 am with bug bites and found 2 brown bugs crawling on the sheets. We showed them to the person at the desk. He said he didn't know what kind of bugs they were, but that he would tell the maid to do a better job... When we arrived back to the States, we had the bugs in plastic baggies and found out they are bed bugs. The bites don't affect some people, but I had HORRIBLE reactions, and even worse, you can bring them home in your luggage and infest your home. I am going to make a complaint to the hotel, but don't know whether or not anything will be done about it, so at this point, I would recommend finding somewhere else to stay! Other than this massive problem, the hotel is lovely and seems to be clean. Staff is friendly and helpful. STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Small Hotel in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: binky63
Reviews.Content: If you have traveled to Europe before, you understand that hotel rooms can be very small, and you are lucky to have a bathroom on the same floor as your room! Hotel Oceana has large rooms and a wc in each one of them. They offer a continental breakfast each morning consisting of bread, coffee, tea, tortes, packaged toast , various jams and some pastry. The Orange juice is simply the best OJ I have ever had! Internet is available on the lobby computor, but time is limited. You may only access it from 9 am to 1 then late afternoon. I still have not figured that one out! After chatting with Anna (our hostess) I found out that this building is owned by the Methodist Church and is occupied by several small business', individual apartments and 2 Hotels. Hotel Oceana is on the third floor and consists of 15 rooms (I think) the hotel is accessible via the stairway or the small cage style elevator. If you have the stamina, take the stairs... Its faster at times and not quite as scary. I was only disapointed by a couple of things. First I read somewhere that laundry facilities were available, they are not. Even though there was a washer and dryer on floor. Second was the window in our room. Call me an overprotective mom, but our 4 year old son was traveling with us, and the window was very easy to open and had no screen in place, it did have an outer levered wood hinged screen, but again, it was easily open with just a small hook keeping it closed. My son wanted to drag a chair to the window to look out on several occasions. With nothing to prevent him from falling out the window 3 stories high, I was more than just a little stressed. Main thing is if you are traveling with a young one, dont even acknowledge the window and you should be fine. I would also suggest that you bring an extra pillow if you like them fluffy. My father inlaw had a fit about the towels, THEY ARE NOT TERRY TOWELS. So be warned. These are very absorbant towels, but if you want warm fuzzy towels, bring your own. Easy walk to several restaraunts. Ask them for directions to Da Giovanis (great food and very reasonable...... for Rome) Another great little spot is just down the street from the hotel and is perfect for a late night snack. I cant remember the name but, when you exit the hotel and turn left, you will see a small bistro cafe on the right about half a block down. Just a quick note, they are open late and you can grab a late night Mozerella and Procuito Panini if you didnt have a chance to get dinner or are too tired to go out. The owner will even pop the cork on a small bottle of wine so you can take your meal back to the hotel. Easy walk to the bus stop and the main terminal where you are off and running. They say it is within walking distance to several attractions, primarily the Trevi fountain. You can walk if you are in shape to do so, but it is a hike and some of the hills can be quite steep. Overall, I thought Hotel Oceana was a charming place with wonderful hosts. I really hope to visit it again (maybe with not so many travel companions next time!)

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful Oasis in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: HowieRoll09
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 2 week trip in Italy, and one of our favorite hotels along the way was Hotel Oceania. The property is beautiful, and has a cozy, peaceful feel - a great respite after an exhausting day of navigating Rome and seeing the sights. We found the location to be excellent, a 10 minute walk from Termini (where you can catch the inner-city Metro) and about a 10-15 minute walk to most of the major sights. The staff (Radu, Anna, Michael, and everyone else) were very friendly and they work hard to make the hotel feel like 'home.' The rooms are very clean and beautifully decorated, and have a lot of small touches that the owner, Stefano, takes pride in. For instance, the towels are not the normal 'hotel terrycloth', but instead are a very high-quality, expensive Egyptian cotton. They feel very luxurious and dry very fast (and are replaced with fresh ones every day). Overall, we were extremely pleased with Hotel Oceania. Rome is a loud, busy city, and after spending your day out with the masses and walking all day, this hotel is the perfect spot to unwind. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: mckcol
Reviews.Content: Good location, near subway and Termini station. Quiet, friendly, corteous staff - good recommendations for restaurants. No kettle in room, no Tea or coffee facilities in the evening. Unstocked mini-bar in room, so you can buy in your own refreshments. Breakfast basic continental, no meats or eggs - rolls, jams, cakes, cheese, biscuits. Would stay here again - with a travel kettle!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, excellent location, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: CageBird
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the room so much, that we rebooked for a night on our return home. The hotel is located near palacial government buildings and blocks from the main train terminal and metro. You were always a few steps away from being home (important when carrying large shopping bags). The room had its own temp. control & it worked beautifully. The 24 hour staff was very helpful - checking train schedules, calling taxis, and making dinner recommendations. The quality of the hotel was more than expected for such an affordable price. We were thrilled.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: homebody222
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located by the termini train station. It is an easy walk if you know where you are going. You can also walk to the other attractions. There is also 2 metro stations very close to the hotel that you can take to the major attractions for 1 euro/pp. We stayed at this hotel at the beginning and the end of our vacation. The first room we had was #15 and it was great. very clean and the coldest AC I've had in Europe. The second time we checked in we had room #2 (on the other side of the hotel) and it was not nearly as good, but still clean. The downside of this hotel is that the TV is very small and the remote control didn't work. It advertises sat. TV but I didn't see it and we didn't have any channels that were in English. The elevator is a little scary as well. The hotel also advertises that laundry facilities are available...which is tru...but it is a laundromat about 20 mins away! I would generally recommend this hotel and it is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Tropicfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled throughout Italy over the past two years. Yes, the hotel rooms are quite different than those in the United States (smaller, fewer amenities, etc.) However, this hotel was a very pleasant surprise. We booked two double rooms (we traveled with another couple) for three days at the beginning of September. The weather was still quite hot in Rome, and the Hotel Oceania had wonderful air-conditioning in each room (hard to find in Rome hotels). There was a simple but satisfying breakfast each morning, complete with juice, tea and/or coffee. There's also a wonderful sitting area with a flat screen TV, magazines and books if one needs a relaxing moment or two. Our rooms were large by European standards and so were the bathrooms and showers. We never had a problem with the noise. It's a very central location, with the Metro and bus stop only a block away. It's well within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. Vatican City is a 10 minute Metro ride away in one direction and the Colosseum/Forum is less than a 10 minute Metro ride in the other direction. Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much and will definitely stay there again on our next return trip. Bottom line: If you can't or don't want to spend big bucks to stay in the few luxury hotels that are in Rome, this is a great choice. Note: The hotel is on the third floor - MANY steps or a very small (2 person max) elevator gets you there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Bathrooms, but Noisy; 4th Floor”
Reviews.Author: chchien
Reviews.Content: The noise is definitely a problem at this hotel. We had room number one (right next to the breakfast area) and throughout the night we were woken up by the doorbell (you have to ring to get admitted after a certain hour). Shortly before 8am, we were awoken again by the sounds of breakfast being set up. The doors in this hotel are very old and incredibly thin, and there's practically nothing between you and the hallway. It makes for very fitful sleep. That having been said, the room was clean and the bathrooms were newly remodeled in a very tasteful decor. One negative about the bathrooms was the towels -- at first we thought that they were tablecloths and I actually ran out to check! They're very thin, rough, and not useful for drying much of anything. Also, be aware that the entry for this hotel is on the 4th floor and you'll find yourself walking up very long flights of stairs to get there. There is a _very_ small elevator, but it looks like it's from the early 1900s and is not always callable.

Reviews.Title: “"Rear Window"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were really disappointed in the hotel. The rooms were okay, however, the noise was awful. We had a room that faced the open courtyard and the noise was constant, just like the Alfred Hitchcock movie, "Rear Window" - people yelling, classical music playing at all times of the day at a very high volume, children crying .... The safety of the elevator was questionable also. You opened up the wrought iron gates to step inside and it felt like the floor was made of cardboard. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, great breakfeast. One of the best hotels we stayed in in Italy over 3 weeks. 145 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: o33o2
Reviews.Content: I would love to give this hotel a bad review so others would not want to visit - but everyone at the hotel was just so nice I would hate to do that to them. When I travel overseas, I only have two requirements; an elevator and a private bathroom, so my expectations are limited when it comes to the decor or the personalities of the owners. The hotel had the most beautiful decor and the nicest staff. I want to redecorate my bedroom to look just like the room I had at the Hotel Oceania. Absolutely beautiful. Loved the bath sheets in the bathroom. Normally I hate the towels that hotels use, they leave lint on me, and I hate that. These bath sheets are huge and thin and absorb so quickly. I loved them - I want to get them for my home too. The breakfast is a little sweet for me. All sugar. I prefer yogart and cereal, but what they had was delicious, and let's face it - it was included in the price of the room, so if I wanted to, I could have run down to the local market and bought yogurt and cereal and kept it in the refridgerator that was included in my room - but it was not that big of a deal. Normally, when I travel to Rome, I stay with friends who know the area very well. So when they came to see me, and commented on the location and how well situated the hotel is, I was even more impressed. To sum it up, this was a very clean, beautifully decorated hotel; friendly, english speaking staff; well situated; elevator; private bathroom; TV; and much more. I really love this place and will definately stay here again; I just hope that after this review, there is enough space for one more.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel - Beautiful, Spotless & Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To put this review in context: I stay in at least 8 hotels a month. I am a Platinum Guest (highest tier guest) with Starwood (Sheraton and Westin) and have never received the sort of amazing reception I received at Hotel Oceania... and I am not a 'frequent' customer of this hotel - this was our first stay. I read the reviews on Trip Advisor and took my chances... If you are looking for Italy - stay here. If you are looking for a cookie cutter version of American Hotels in Italy - this isn't the place. And, for the record, I'm NOT a Rick Steve's "minion"... My husband and I arrived at the hotel and were quite pleased to find an ever-so-friendly staff, fully willing to help us find a local restaurant, and map out a few things we could see if we took a walk. Oceania is centrally located. We walked to the Coliseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and once, walked back from the Vatican. St. Theresa in Ecstasy is around the corner, the National Museum of Rome is a 5 minute walk... The Spanish Steps are very close, too. The whole time we were in Rome, we probably took 4 taxis, including the taxis to and from the airport! Our room was beautiful - golds and greens... right on the street - but I heard little noise from cars or motorbikes. The room and bathroom were clean; the linens on the bed and the draperies were gorgeous. Our room had the feeling of Italian charm and elegance without over-the-top opulence. The bath towels are big - like bath sheets and thin - you can wrap them around you and hang them up for a quick dry. I loved them. Every day of our 8 day stay - our room was made up nicely. In the morning - a lovely breakfast was set-out. Rosetta rolls and cheese, little cakes and croissants... as well as our own little table with coffee and steamed milk, made by Armando - who if your Italian is as bad as mine - will teach you a little more! He was quick with a smile and made the morning bright which helped us to get ready to tackle a day of sightseeing. My husband and I were quickly charmed by this kind man and looked forward to seeing him every morning! We had the great fortune to chat with the busy owner - Stefano who gave us great restaurant recommendations and talked about his favorite place for gelato. It was unbelievable that this man who is opening a new hotel in Tuscany (which we will be visiting soon) had the time to chat with two tourists from California! He listened and was very interested in how we experienced his hotel and the service we received. That has never happened in a big corporate hotel (where I’m ‘platinum’) - and I don't expect it ever will! When I return to Italy with my parents this Fall – I will take them to Hotel Oceania – where I know they will be as charmed as we were. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Tisch
Reviews.Content: Hotel Oceania was a great find. The rooms were big compared to European standards. Bathrooms were somewhat small, but still ample to move around in. (Small bathrooms are very common in hotels that set up in older buildings) Loved our A/C. It was heaven, compared to the Italian Heat. The staff were always so welcoming ,very helpful, and spoke perfect English. We enjoyed the free use of the internet which we were able to check our e-mail, and also find information for Rome. Breakfast was good. . . breads, juices, and pastries. It was enough to get us started for the day. It is walking distance to Metro station, Trevi Fountain, etc. Also Church Santa Susanna (tickets for papal audience) was around the corner. It was very convenient for us to pick up our tickets. The day we checked-out, the Hotel allowed us to leave our baggage until our early evening flight. We had an extra 4 hours in Rome to walk around and we did not have to worry about our luggage. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The Oceania was Great”
Reviews.Author: MAWTraveler
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on the Oceania and took a chance like so many do when traveling abroad. Well thanks to the Trip Advisor and it's users we couldn't have been more pleased with our stay at the Oceania. The staff was very friendly and helpful and spoke very good English. The rooms were very comfortable and imaculate, this was a big plus. The area the hotel is in seemed very safe as it is near the govt. bldgs. and there are lots of police and military around. We wanted to be close to the railroad station and it is. The only suggestion is that although it is close the walk on Roman roads is not easy so if you haven't packed light you may want to take a taxi. There is a lot of traffic and the roads are very bumpy for pulling a bag. We overpacked and learned our lesson. I would recommend this hotel highly, it's location, tasty breakfast(excellent coffee) clean, friendly staff, what more can I say.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was Ok”
Reviews.Author: hm1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in late November. We had a room at the corner of via Firenze and via Settembre. The rooms are not sound proofed so if you are a light sleeper you would have a hard time sleeping with traffic sounds (loud). Also, the street was filled with military personnel (defense ministry across the street) who migh make it feel safe but which made me uncomfortable, felt like a war zone. The room was big but the bathrooms were small, the shower curtain stuck to you while having shower, uncomfortable. The room was clean and neat. The breakfast left much to be desired, every morning a big loaf of cold bread and pastries left over from the previous day. The coffee and juice was good. The hotel was convenient to the metro, termini and all the sites. A laundromat was a 10 minute walk away. Free internet access was availble in the lobby and the staff was friendly and somewhat helpful. Would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: ZoomLady
Reviews.Content: Our October 2005 stay at Hotel Oceania was a pleasant one with friendly and helpful staff, where we enjoyed a large room that was clean and quiet. The hotel also has free internet access for guests. The area around the Termini train station is quite safe day and night due to the Defense Ministry being there. The Repubblica Metro station and Termini are within a 10 minute walk of the hotel, as well. The breakfast offered bread and jams as well as pastries (more like what Americans think of as dessert pies). We found it odd that in some Rome hotel rooms (including here) there are signs in the bathrooms that say you are forbidden to wash out your clothes in the sink. Of the three hotels we stayed at in Rome on our trip, Oceania is the only one we'd return to.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable family-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: robndavid
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, friendly and welcoming staff. Phone-box sized lift a challenge if you have a large-ish suitcase. Hotel is on 3rd floor so carrying suitcases up is not an option. Located within easy walking distance to major attractions such as Colosseum, Fonatana di Trevi, Borghese Gardens, Piazza Navona, Piazza Repubblica, Piazza Barberini and Via Veneto. About 15 minutes walk from main train station. Room comfortable and adequate size. Newly renovated with ensuite (compact shower). Nicely decorated and air conditioned. Pleasant, if small, communal lounge area. Standard tasty continental breakfast, but as in many hotels, did not start until 8am. If you need early check-out or departure for day trips, you will miss breakfast as there is no facility for an earlier meal. No in-room tea or coffee making facilities, but does have bar fridge (not stocked). We stayed for 6 nights and were overall quite pleased. Would be happy to stay there again as represented good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Aaagghhhh! Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 1 night only on our tour of Europe and this was without a doubt the most horrible room we had our entire trip! Where do I start, the room was smelly, dingy and 'just' clean. The bathroom was so small that while you were in the shower if you bent over you would knock yourself out on the basin! The towels were tablecloths!!!! I am not joking. We staying other Italian hotels and came across this kind of linen for hand towels etc. but to dry your body with?!!! The breakfast was the most limited of any hotel we stayed in in Europe. When I asked for a second bread roll for breakfast (unlike other hotels where you help yourself, they were hidden away like gold behind the bar!) I was given one with an abrupt "hmmm"! Take my advice and spend an the extra few bucks and stay at Residenza Cellini, it's an absolute world away!!!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was on the recommended list of Rick Steves”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel and the room were clean. The staff, Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The location is a short distance from the train station and not far from the sites of Rome. The hotel was on the recomended list of Rick Steves who writes travel books and videoes. We would not have a problem returning to the Oceania.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Plus at Hotel Oceania Rome”
Reviews.Author: wildlife
Reviews.Content: We were happy to stay at Hotel Oceania for three nights beginning October 1, 2005. The accommodations were lovely and spotlessly clean. The staff was gracious and accommodating. The breakfast was impressive, with various pates, freshly baked hard rolls like we can't find in USA, various cheeses, pastries and cakes, and wonderful Caffe Italiano! We walked everywhere from the convenient location. The owner, Stefano, was charming and helpful, and we enjoyed our visits with him. We felt the rate we paid was very reasonable considering all the above. I guess you can tell that we heartily recommend Hotel Oceania to any one who enjoys the intimate family run hotel experience, and for those who enjoy the large chain hotels, try something different for a change! You might like it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Linz99
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been more pleased with our stay in Oceania. We had a double room that was spotless and also quite spacious. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and answered any questions we had on places to visit etc. The internet access was very useful and was free. Breakfast was lovely - breads, pastries, juices and coffee. The hotel is in an ideal location, close to all the main sites and on a nice quiet street. Would love to go back!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Oceania
HotelInfo.Address: Via Firenze, 38, 00184 Rome, Italy
